oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from R. A. Gordon to Capt. A. R. Gordon
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Rebecca A. Gordon writes to her husband, a prisoner of war at Johnson's Island, Ohio. She notes that there is a great deal of talk about peace after Lee's surrender. The preaching at the school was "quite a treat," and the "bright star of hope shine[s] brightly on me." Andrew Ruthven Gordon, a slaveholding farmer, was a captain in Co. E, Holman's 11th Tenn. Cav. Regt. He married Rebecca Dickerson of Lynnville.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee State Library and Archives, Nashville, Davidson County, Tennessee
